subject: Business
title: Hiring Your First Ten
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Hiring Your First Ten.

hook.text: Your first ten hires define your startup's DNA. Every early employee shapes the culture forever.

buildup.text: Early employees need to be generalists who thrive in chaos â€” not specialists who need structure.

discovery.text: The best early hires are slightly overqualified people excited by the mission and autonomy.

twist.text: Hiring fast backfires. One toxic hire at employee five poisons the whole team.

climax.text: Stripe took months to hire their first employees, prioritizing quality over speed.

punchline.text: Hire slow at the start. You're building the foundation.

quiz.question: What type of employee works best in a very early startup?
options: Specialists with deep expertise in one area
